Name: Azure/.NET Developer
Details:
Azure/.NET Developer

100% Remote

We are seeking an experienced developer to design and implement cloud-based solutions using Microsoft Azure technologies. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background in Azure services and a proven track record of delivering high-quality software solutions.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Design, develop, and implement cloud-based solutions using Microsoft Azure services
Ensure the quality and performance of delivered solutions by performing code reviews, testing, and debugging
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to determine requirements and develop technical solutions
Maintain current knowledge of emerging Azure technologies and trends, and make recommendations for improving current solutions
Provide technical support and troubleshoot issues as necessary
Required

Strong programming experience in C#, .NET core, and SQL Server
Experience developing ETL pipelines in the cloud using Azure Data Factory or similar
Experience with front end development and client side scripting (JavaScript, CSS, html, etc)
Experience integrating enterprise systems such as Salesforce and Workday using Azure services, including Azure Functions, API Management, Azure Service Bus, and Event Grid
Ability to design and implement secure, scalable, and efficient data integrations leveraging REST APIs, webhooks, and ETL process
Experience with developing, deploying, and maintaining cloud-based solutions
5+ years of experience in software development, with a focus on Microsoft Azure
Beneficial Skills

Experience with Azure DevOps, including continuous integration and continuous deployment
Experience with Python for analytics and application development, including building web applications using Flask and Dash.
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development environment
Microsoft Certification

% Objective Section
\section*{Bio}
\color{textcolor}
\paragraph{}
Jason Lind is a seasoned technology leader with over two decades of experience in software architecture and development, particularly focused on Microsoft Azure technologies. His extensive background includes designing and implementing cloud-based solutions that are not only efficient but also scalable and secure, aligning perfectly with the responsibilities of an Azure/.NET Developer. Throughout his career, Jason has successfully leveraged his strong technical expertise in C\#, .NET Core, and SQL Server to deliver high-quality software solutions that meet organizational needs.

Jason’s professional journey includes significant contributions to various industries, where he has honed his skills in integrating enterprise systems using Azure services. His work has involved developing ETL pipelines using Azure Data Factory and creating robust front-end applications through frameworks like Blazor. He has consistently collaborated with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, facilitating the design of innovative technical solutions that adhere to the latest trends in Azure technologies and best practices for cloud deployments. 

Furthermore, Jason's dedication to continuous improvement is evident in his roles as an entrepreneur and consultant, where he has modernized legacy systems and driven business transformation initiatives. His leadership experience in Agile/Scrum environments, coupled with his ability to maintain architectural clarity while embracing emerging technologies, positions him as an ideal candidate for the Azure/.NET Developer role. 

\begin{itemize}
    \item Over 20 years of experience in software architecture and development.
    \item Proven expertise in designing and implementing cloud-based solutions using Microsoft Azure.
    \item Strong programming background in C\#, .NET Core, and SQL Server.
    \item Experience developing ETL pipelines in Azure Data Factory and integrating systems using Azure services.
    \item Proficient in front-end development with frameworks such as Blazor and React.
    \item Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams and modernize legacy systems effectively.
\end{itemize}

One of his notable achievements was the development of a web-based Construction Scheduler designed for Town and Country Homes, which streamlined complex construction tasks through an efficient scheduling engine and user-friendly interface. Additionally, he managed the creation of a Corporate Bankruptcy Administration Portal for Phase11 Consultants, which allowed non-technical users to easily customize their data and workflows, showcasing his ability to deliver scalable and adaptable software solutions.

\begin{itemize}
    \item Spearheaded the development of a web-based Construction Scheduler incorporating AJAX-rendered UI and complex task dependencies.
    \item Developed a Corporate Bankruptcy Administration Portal enabling customizable screens and logic for diverse client needs using ASP.NET WebForms and SQL Server.
    \item Architected scalable solutions that balanced technical sophistication with usability, improving time-to-market and reducing development overhead.
\end{itemize}

% Education Section
\section*{Education}

\filbreak
\subsection*{\textbf{\color{subheadercolor}Marquette University} \hfill \textbf{\color{textcolor}Electrical and Computer Engineering Major, Political Science Minor} }
\color{textcolor}
\textit May-2000 -- Dec-2002 \\
Jason's journey at MU began at the age of 15 when he enrolled as a part-time non-degree student in the College of Arts and Sciences. During this time, he took for-credit courses such as Introduction to Object-Oriented Programming, Calculus, and Differential Equations. By age 16, he transitioned from part-time non-degree status to a full-time engineering student, marking the start of his path in the engineering field.

In addition to his academic achievements, Jason was highly involved in student organizations. He served as an officer in several groups, including as the Treasurer and External Committee Chair of the Engineering Student Council (ESC), the President of IEEE, the Midwest Regional Vice President of Finance for the National Association of Engineering Student Councils (NAESC), and the co-founder of the MU-MUHS F.I.R.S.T. Robotics team. As a co-founder, he raised over \$25,000 in just three weeks to start the team, demonstrating his leadership and fundraising capabilities. In his role as Treasurer for ESC, Jason was instrumental in growing the budget from a few thousand dollars to nearly \$15,000 annually, significantly enhancing the council's financial resources.

\filbreak
\subsection*{\textbf{\color{subheadercolor}Harvard University} \hfill \textbf{\color{textcolor}Thesis Prosecutor} }
\color{textcolor}
\textit Apr-2002 -- Apr-2002 \\
At age 17, Jason sat on a PhD Defense Panel at the John F. Kennedy School of Government, contributing to the evaluation of a groundbreaking thesis. The research applied the Infect-Stay-Infect differential equation to Union Behavior, with the author demonstrating that unions have a coefficient similar to syphilis. This early exposure to high-level academic discussions reflected Jason's exceptional ability to engage with complex, interdisciplinary topics at a young age.

\filbreak
\subsection*{\textbf{\color{subheadercolor}Marquette University High School}  }
\color{textcolor}
\textit Aug-1998 -- May-2001 \\
Jason attended MUHS through his junior year before transitioning to full-time at MU Engineering as a sophomore at age 16. Alongside his academic pursuits, he was highly involved in extracurricular activities. He served as co-captain of MUHS's Chess Club, which ranked second in the state, demonstrating his strategic thinking and leadership. Jason was also the Portfolio Director for a real-money investment portfolio, where the profits were used to fund need-based scholarships for incoming freshmen. Additionally, he played a pivotal role as the founding National Deputy Director of the Junior State of America's (JSA) CIA, an organization dedicated to fostering political and civic engagement among youth.
